Info.Description: Adds random noise to the image. This noise is generated using a hash function, creating a unique and random pattern of pixels. It can be used to add a texture or grain to an image, or to introduce randomness in graphic designs.

Properties.Name: Amount
Properties.Summary: Controls the overall intensity of the noise added to the image. Sliding towards a higher value increases the noise amount, making it more pronounced, while a lower value adds a subtle noise effect.

Properties.Name: Luminance
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the brightness of the noise. A higher value will create brighter noise pixels, while a lower value results in darker noise pixels.

Properties.Name: Monochromatic
Properties.Summary: Determines whether the noise added is monochromatic (black and white) or colored.

Properties.Name: Seed
Properties.Summary: Alters the random seed used to generate the noise. Changing the value will produce a different pattern of noise, but the overall appearance (determined by the other settings) will remain the same.
